WRITING.TEXT: you're not a freak. my legs look like yours. our scars tell stories. i gave up hiding my scars a long time ago, its too fkn hot in australia to hide them

WRITING.TITLE: long time stalker, first time poster. this is my favourite photo of me and my brother featuring the only four scars i really hate out of the hundreds on my thighs and forearms. plus more beneath the tats

WRITING.TEXT: wow one year clean is an incredible achievement. keep on keeping on x

i guess that depends on why you self harm. heres a list of things that help for me depending on the purpose of sh that day: 1. feeling numb. take a cold shower, roll down a grassy hill, make some tea and hold the hot mug in my hands, anything that helps me FEEL. 2. feeling angry. scream into a pillow, punch a pillow, tear paper, use a red texta to "cut" lines where i want to self harm, go running or skateboarding. 3. feeling overwhelmed and seeking relief. go upside down! i love to do handstands and headstands and find them really helpful. but i think anything that gets you moving or changes your physical environment is good. 4. feeling like i need to be punished. this is by far the hardest one to deal with and i'm still working out to cope with it. i try to journal things out. i hope that helps? and was what you were looking for? congrats on 4 years clean
i hope you're in a better place now. i try to get tattoos as incentive to stop harming... the problem is staying clean long enough to get the scars tattooed over :/

probably. i had some of a similar depth (i think) that faded within a year. do NOT get some sunburnt - this will bleach them, not fade them! use some sort of oil on them to soften them up as well, bio oil is good but a little exxy, i use the Sukin body oil which is much more affordable and works better imo

so important. and i agree, i am well known in the local emergency for my scars, and they're maybe still "bad" by this subs standards, but all sh is bad and all sh is valid and hurting ourselves should never be a contest. it is awesome when this community is supportive but not as much when it becomes competitive...
i think they did, you can see the suture marks
speaking as someone with scars like these - you don't want to know
they can pop open if the stitches come out too early
wait what, your throat was cut in school?
it will soften, lighten and flatten. don't get it sunburnt - this will bleach it
that's awful. i'm so sorry

all self harm is valid, visible or not, cutting or otherwise. you don't want to go deeper. it won't make you feel better. in fact, it will probably make you feel worse since you will constantly be heading to emergency or your doctors for stitches, probably being kept in hospital involuntarily more and more often. self harm helped me a lot and i only started to hate it once i started going deeper
me too, someone will say yes x
other people suck. i gave up hiding my scars a long time ago and just wear whatever i want now. my life motto: if you don't like it, don't look

as someone with scars like these, trust me, that is not something to wish for. sure, it helped. thats why i cut - it helps. but the scarring, itchiness and shame of deep scars... not worth it. its shit being addicted to something you hate and love and want and need and also want to be rid of forever. like most addictions i guess
yeah. its tough. inbox me if you want to talk about it x

i keep a crepe bandage on hand which is reusavle, always pad them up with toilet paper then wrap with the bandage to hold it in place. if im desperate after having gone too deep and am needing stitches i will wrap a towel or bathmat around my leg / arm and use strapping tape to hold it in place
yes!! i love this!! my life motto that helps me say F them - if you don't like it, dont look

yes x i have similar ones. i like to use Sukin brand body oil (its like Bio Oil but cheaper and works better imo) and do NOT get them sunburnt!!! sun will BLEACH scars not fade them! and once they are bleached they will not fade!
as long as you use something clean and a fabric that wont leave fluff behind if it gets stuck, you'll be fine
i reckon they will fade a little more. massaging when you use oil / scar cream / moisturiser will also help to soften and eventually flatten them
moisturise and massage it in, they will soften and flatten and fade. it just takes time
ooo post updates!

WRITING.TEXT: as far as i can tell, time

moisturiser / scar cream / body oil. i use Sukin brand body oil which is similar to Bio Oil but much more affordable. massage it in as this helps break apart scar tissue. do NOT get them sunburnt - this will bleach them, not fade them. once they have been bleached, they will not fade
yeah not gory, just lucky. his glove was slightly too big and was sucked into the saw

my burns didnt scar. but i also cut over the top of them. if it was just a flame from a match / lighter it will probably fade, if you were putting out a cigarette it might not (i dont know why this is, i just noticed a difference in how mine and my friends burns healed)

my guess is no, scar tissue is made from collagen which tends to expand past the wound

not true imo. as long as you don't get them sunburnt (it bleaches the scar tissue) then you will see them start to soften flatten and fade... it just takes time. oils can help - i use Sukin brand body oil since it is soooo much cheaper than Bio oil
you're not alone. my legs look the same.
6-12 months. they need to soften lighten and flatten. if you tattoo too soon the scars could get worse

i gave up a long time ago... i hide my scars at work and around my family but thats all

its a fat deposit. they're quite easy to get out if it bothers you, squeeze it like a pimple or grab it with some tweezers
nope not dangerous!

no - to be blunt, it is not normal and it should not be normalised as a hormonal teenage girl thing. it took me a long time to realise that the way i felt and behaved was not normal. but such extreme moods are not something that everyone goes through. not everyone thinks about "the final yeet". it took me a long time to realise that some people may never experience suicidal thoughts or think about hurting themselves but once i did, things really changed. believe me when i say that not all teenage girls think like that.
a shoulder / arm (you can tell from the electrode placement, i assume its ecg leads)

please look after the wounds and close them if they need it, steri strips (aka paper stitches) are a life saver. even if you're not bothered by scarring, deeper cuts are much more prone to infection so its worth cleaning and closing them
if you're over 16 you're not a minor and can ask to speak to the doctor privately and they have to respect patient doctor confidentiality

if you see beans, especially if the fat is bubbling out of the woundc it does need to be stitched. it will heal if you don't but it can take months to heal from the bottom up and cuts of that depth are really prone to infection. you don't necessarily need to go to hospital, if you have a family doctor you trust they can stitch it for you (missed the added edit after writing all that - i hope you're ok, keep us updated!)

hope you're okay - did u end up getting stitches?

no hydrogen peroxide! (aka neosporin) since it destroys new cell tissue. keep it dressed, and moist is better than letting it dry out. they're a little exxy but if u can get your hands on some Mepilex style dressings they are waterproof and silicone, and can be left on for up to a week. worth it imo. inbox me if u need any other firstaid advice - always happy to help

i'm not going to convince you that ODing is not the answer but i will let you know what happened when i ODed on my ADHD meds (i was on dexamphetamine) so you can make a more informed decision. to repeat: im not encouraging you to OD and im also not going to try and convince you not to because thats not my place and you have the right to make your own choices. ADHD meds are stimulants. most drugs which are used in OD are depressants (like alcohol, benzos and the like) which typically cause death via central nervous system depression aka you don't realise you aren't breathing. that is not the case with adhd meds. they cause death typically via cardiac arrest of some kind or hypertension or tachycardia (which is high blood pressure and high heart rate respectively). if it fails, its not pleasant. i won't specify the dose i took, but according to "minimum lethal doses" it should have killed me. it didn't- it just kept me awake for 3 days and triggered a manic episode (i have combined borderline personality disorder with bipolar). i was taken to the hospital under schedule (ie against my will) and had to be observed for 36 hours because my heart rate wouldn't come down to a normal pace. if you want to talk more about it, drop me a msg, always happy to talk x source: i study medical sciences and i have survived many suicide attempts, two of which were ODs with adhd meds
any photos post facial reconstruction?

you ARE so so much more than this. these scars might still be part of your story but you've finished that chapter - don't give any energy to it! so proud of you for fighting and continuing to fight

if you have a gp / family doctor you trust they can look at it for you! i have also found my gp is more likely to take the time to talk to me and will often do stitches to help with healing, they can be a little rushed at er sometimes. idk your age but you absolutely do not have to involve your parents if you are 16 or over, if them finding out is stopping you from seeking medical attention. also, i am not triggered by fresh cuts, am a medical student and self harmer and am happy to give advice if you want to inbox me. stay strong and stay safe #10084; #65039; #10084; #65039;

genetics, depth, aftercare. i have atrophic (sunken), hypertrophic and flat scars from self harming. i get hypertrophic scars from deep wounds (like fat depth) that weren't stitched or that i didn't look after properly and kept picking the scabs off of or whatever

they look like sun spots or birth marks to me. the person who will always notice your scars the most is YOU.

or get sunburnt! sunburn bleaches scars and when they turn white as a result it is permanent! (whereas when they fade naturally they eventually disappear altogether, depending on the depth of the initial wound)

wow. im a bit speechless. thanks for sharing so much information and images. i have a lofty goal of eventually becoming a surgeon or anaesthesiologist so i found this very interesting

hmm, my guess is different kinds of lipids? depending on the body part it was taken from, the fat tissue could be of different densities. it could also be something involved in the actual lipo process that causes separation (like how the high speed of a centrifuge separates the components of hematocrit) - but these are my best guesses! not a medical professional, just studying to be one!

there are many possible infections concerns after having nails full depth through the knee. a tetanus shot only protects against tetanus and that is only one condition of many. since the nails went full depth, i imagine they wanted to make sure there was no debris chilling in there. it may also have been done to relieve pressure and prevent compartment syndrome. source - im a med student

WRITING.TEXT: wow interesting. thanks for that
yeah, my thinking is that if they were worried about pressure / compartment syndrome then that would explain not opting for a laparoscopy
yep, it refers to the depth of the cut. these typically don't bleed much and rarely need stitches but that is a pretty blanket generalisation. below styro we have beans (which is fat)
see the above comments thanks. hugs are a good cure all.
um, muscle ... depending on the spot. it could be the tendon sheath then tendon. or it could be the fascicle and then muscle
yes. if you can see fat, or anything beyond fat, it will need stitching

beans depth will eventually heal without stitches but in areas over joints or on hands / feet / face, stitches will help the wound to heal and also limit the amount of long term affects on mobility due to scar tissue beans deep cuts are also really really prone to infection and should be seen to for that reason. you don't have to go to hospital (er/ed/a amp;e) btw if you have a family doctor you trust they should be able to stitch it for you
